intro: Lycopsis arvensis subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western field lycopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to western North America and often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
